biography.bio: Dieter Borsche was born on October 25, 1909 in Hannover, Germany as Albert Eugen Rollomann. He was an actor and director, known for No Greater Love (1952), Die große Versuchung (1952) and His Royal Highness (1953). He was married to Ursula Willick, Monika Drum and Ursula Poser. He died on August 5, 1982 in Nuremberg, Bavaria, West Germany.
biography.name: Dieter Borsche

biography.bio: Kristina Söderbaum was born on 5 October 1912 in Stockholm, Sweden. She was a professor's daughter from Djursholm, Stockholm, Sweden. After graduation she went to Paris to learn French and by chance got a role in the short film Hur behandlar du din hund? (1934). In 1935, she studied history of art in Berlin and attended acting classes. There she got to know her future husband Veit Harlan. During WWII Kristina Söderbaum played the main parts in popular Nazi propaganda movies under the direction of her husband Veit Harlan. Between 1939 and 1945 they made together the successful films Covered Tracks (1938), The Immortal Heart (1939), The Trip to Tilsit (1939), La ville dorée (1942), Le lac aux chimères (1943), The Great Sacrifice (1944) and Kolberg (1945). The most infamous was Le juif Suss (1940), a strong antisemitic propaganda film. Three years after "Jud Süss" she became an honoury student at Uppsala University, Sweden. Söderbaum said after the war that she regretted the films, but she never made a comeback as a popular actress. She didn't work until Harlan was allowed to direct again in 1950 and then appeared mostly in his films and on German TV until the 1990s. After Harlan's death in the 1964, she also established herself as a fashion photographer in Munich, Germany and wrote her memoirs, "Nichts bleibt immer so", in 1983. On 12 February 2001, she died in Hitzacker, Lower Saxony, Germany.
biography.name: Kristina Söderbaum

biography.bio: Walter Giller was born on August 23, 1927 in Recklinghausen, Germany. He was an actor, known for Drei Mann in einem Boot (1961), The Conjugal Bed (1963) and The Captain from Köpenick (1956). He was married to Nadja Tiller. He died on December 15, 2011 in Hamburg, Germany.
biography.name: Walter Giller

biography.bio: Carla Hagen was born on September 11, 1931 in Hamburg, Germany as Carla-Maria Hagen. She is an actress, known for Le plongeon de Véra (1999), Die Frau des Fotografen oder Die große Liebe (1967) and Hôtel du commerce (1969).
biography.name: Carla Hagen

biography.placeOfBirth: Kattowitz, Upper Silesia, Germany [now Katowice, Slaskie, Poland]
biography.bio: Willy Fritsch was born on January 27, 1901 in Kattowitz, Upper Silesia, Germany as Wilhelm Egon Fritz Fritsch. He was an actor, known for Woman in the Moon (1929), Vienna Blood (1942) and Le congrès s'amuse (1931). He was married to Dinah Grace. He died on July 13, 1973 in Hamburg, Germany.
biography.name: Willy Fritsch

biography.bio: Walter Gross was born on February 5, 1904 in Eberswalde, Germany as Walter Hugo Gross. He was an actor, known for Drüben bei Lehmanns (1970), One or the Other (1974) and Frauen wollen betrogen sein (1937). He was married to Ingeborg Strakosch and Lou Seitz. He died on May 17, 1989 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Walter Gross

biography.bio: A stunningly attractive, dark-haired star of post-war revue films, she was born Vera Kmet, the daughter of a German mother and a Hungarian (engineer) father. Encouraged to pursue acting after successful screen testing in Berlin, she went on to pursue drama studies in Vienna at the Reinhardt Seminar (1943-1945) at night, while conscripted to work in an armaments factory during the daytime. Following the end of the war, Vera, trying to supplement her meagre income, was caught up in black market activities and spent sixteen months in an Austrian prison. Her life changed dramatically, when she was discovered singing at a cafe during the Salzburg opera season by the director Géza von Cziffra, who changed her name to Molnar and starred her as wordly, emancipated women in several of his films, notably Gabriela (1950), Une fille du tonnerre (1950) and the romantic musical comedy Le Rêve multicolore (1952), the most lavish production thus far undertaken in post-war Germany. At the same time, Vera and her (married) Svengali conducted a not entirely discreet affair, living together at a rented house in Hamburg. U.S. immigration authorities subsequently denied her a visa and thereby the opportunity to act in Hollywood due to her 'criminal past'. From the mid-1950's, Vera continued to pop up in a brace of undistinguished international productions, which did little for her rapidly waning career. By the end of the decade, she called it quits. Having established dual residencies in Rome and Vienna in the 1960's, she committed her remaining years to the muse of painting.
biography.name: Vera Molnar

biography.bio: Hans Nielsen was born on November 30, 1911 in Hamburg, Germany as Hans Albert Nielsen. He was an actor and assistant director, known for Titanic (1943), Town Without Pity (1961) and Destination Death (1964). He was married to Anna Katharina Elisabeth Novian and Annemarie Giersch. He died on October 11, 1965 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Hans Nielsen

biography.bio: Eckart Dux was born on December 19, 1926 in Berlin, Germany. He is an actor, known for Les cavaliers de la route (1966), Butler Parker (1972) and Hamburg Transit (1970). He is married to Marlies Dux. He was previously married to Gisela Peltzer.
biography.name: Eckart Dux

biography.bio: Ingrid Stenn was born on November 23, 1932 in Germany. She was an actress, known for They Were So Young (1954), Bewildered Youth (1957) and Die Jubilarin (1969). She died on February 26, 1997.
biography.name: Ingrid Stenn

biography.bio: Willy Millowitsch was born on January 8, 1909 in Cologne, Germany. He was an actor and director, known for Donaug'schichten (1965), National Lampoon's European Vacation (1985) and Der Etappenhase (1969). He was married to Gerda Feldhoff and Linny Lüttgen. He died on September 20, 1999 in Cologne, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany.
biography.name: Willy Millowitsch

biography.bio: Eve Dietrich is an actress, known for Das verbotene Paradies (1958), Das Bad auf der Tenne (1956) and Zwei Herzen im Mai (1958).
biography.name: Eve Dietrich

biography.bio: Willi Rose was born on February 4, 1902 in Berlin, Germany as Wilhelm Bernhard Max Rose. He was an actor, known for Bei Pfeiffers ist Ball (1966), The Beaver Coat (1962) and 100 Jahre Kurfürstendamm (1966). He was married to Inge Rose. He died on June 16, 1978 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Willi Rose

biography.bio: Ralph Lothar was born on July 29, 1910 in Berlin, Germany. He was a director and actor, known for Landarzt Dr. Brock (1967), Jedermannstraße 11 (1962) and Mitternachtszauber (1964). He died on October 14, 1981 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Ralph Lothar

biography.bio: Joe Furtner was born on November 22, 1893 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary as Josef Alois Furtner. He is known for his work on Die Safeknacker-Suite (1963), Fräulein Blaubart (1956) and We Cellar Children (1960). He died on July 30, 1965.
biography.name: Joe Furtner
